17#include <config.h>

19#include <stdio.h>
20#include <inttypes.h>
21#include <isc/string.h> /* Required for HP/UX (and others?) */
22#include <time.h>
23#include <ctype.h>

25#include <isc/print.h>
26#include <isc/region.h>
27#include <isc/serial.h>
28#include <isc/stdtime.h>
29#include <isc/util.h>

31#include <dns/result.h>
32#include <dns/time.h>
33
34static const int days[12] = { 31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31 };
35
36isc_result_t
37dns_time64_totext(int64_t t, isc_buffer_t *target) {
38 struct tm tm;
39 char buf[sizeof("!!!!!!YYYY!!!!!!!!MM!!!!!!!!DD!!!!!!!!HH!!!!!!!!MM!!!!!!!!SS")];
40 int secs;
41 unsigned int l;
42 isc_region_t region;
43
44/*
45 * Warning. Do NOT use arguments with side effects with these macros.
46 */
47#define is_leap(y) ((((y) % 4) == 0 && ((y) % 100) != 0) || ((y) % 400) == 0)
48#define year_secs(y) ((is_leap(y) ? 366 : 365 ) * 86400)
49#define month_secs(m,y) ((days[m] + ((m == 1 && is_leap(y)) ? 1 : 0 )) * 86400)
50
51 tm.tm_year = 70;
52 while (t < 0) {
53 if (tm.tm_year == 0)
54 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
55 tm.tm_year--;
56 secs = year_secs(tm.tm_year + 1900);
57 t += secs;
58 }
59 while ((secs = year_secs(tm.tm_year + 1900)) <= t) {
60 t -= secs;
61 tm.tm_year++;
62 if (tm.tm_year + 1900 > 9999)
63 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
64 }
65 tm.tm_mon = 0;
66 while ((secs = month_secs(tm.tm_mon, tm.tm_year + 1900)) <= t) {
67 t -= secs;
68 tm.tm_mon++;
69 }
70 tm.tm_mday = 1;
71 while (86400 <= t) {
72 t -= 86400;
73 tm.tm_mday++;
74 }
75 tm.tm_hour = 0;
76 while (3600 <= t) {
77 t -= 3600;
78 tm.tm_hour++;
79 }
80 tm.tm_min = 0;
81 while (60 <= t) {
82 t -= 60;
83 tm.tm_min++;
84 }
85 tm.tm_sec = (int)t;
86 /* yyyy mm dd HH MM SS */
87 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%04d%02d%02d%02d%02d%02d",
88 tm.tm_year + 1900, tm.tm_mon + 1, tm.tm_mday,
89 tm.tm_hour, tm.tm_min, tm.tm_sec);
90
91 isc_buffer_availableregion(target, &region);
92 l = strlen(buf);
93
94 if (l > region.length)
95 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
96
97 memmove(region.base, buf, l);
98 isc_buffer_add(target, l);
99 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
100}
101
102int64_t
103dns_time64_from32(uint32_t value) {
104 isc_stdtime_t now;
105 int64_t start;
106 int64_t t;
107
108 /*
109 * Adjust the time to the closest epoch. This should be changed
110 * to use a 64-bit counterpart to isc_stdtime_get() if one ever
111 * is defined, but even the current code is good until the year
112 * 2106.
113 */
114 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
115 start = (int64_t) now;
116 if (isc_serial_gt(value, now))
117 t = start + (value - now);
118 else
119 t = start - (now - value);
120
121 return (t);
122}
123
124isc_result_t
125dns_time32_totext(uint32_t value, isc_buffer_t *target) {
126 return (dns_time64_totext(dns_time64_from32(value), target));
127}
128
129isc_result_t
130dns_time64_fromtext(const char *source, int64_t *target) {
131 int year, month, day, hour, minute, second;
132 int64_t value;
133 int secs;
134 int i;
135
136#define RANGE(min, max, value) \
137 do { \
138 if (value < (min) || value > (max)) \
139 return (ISC_R_RANGE); \
140 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
141
142 if (strlen(source) != 14U)
143 return (DNS_R_SYNTAX);
144 /*
145 * Confirm the source only consists digits. sscanf() allows some
146 * minor exceptions.
147 */
148 for (i = 0; i < 14; i++) {
149 if (!isdigit((unsigned char)source[i]))
150 return (DNS_R_SYNTAX);
151 }
152 if (sscanf(source, "%4d%2d%2d%2d%2d%2d",
153 &year, &month, &day, &hour, &minute, &second) != 6)
154 return (DNS_R_SYNTAX);
155
156 RANGE(0, 9999, year);
157 RANGE(1, 12, month);
158 RANGE(1, days[month - 1] +
159 ((month == 2 && is_leap(year)) ? 1 : 0), day);
160#ifdef __COVERITY__
161 /*
162 * Use a simplified range to silence Coverity warning (in
163 * arithmetic with day below).
164 */
165 RANGE(1, 31, day);
166#endif /* __COVERITY__ */
167
168 RANGE(0, 23, hour);
169 RANGE(0, 59, minute);
170 RANGE(0, 60, second); /* 60 == leap second. */
171
172 /*
173 * Calculate seconds from epoch.
174 * Note: this uses a idealized calendar.
175 */
176 value = second + (60 * minute) + (3600 * hour) + ((day - 1) * 86400);
177 for (i = 0; i < (month - 1); i++)
178 value += days[i] * 86400;
179 if (is_leap(year) && month > 2)
180 value += 86400;
181 if (year < 1970) {
182 for (i = 1969; i >= year; i--) {
183 secs = (is_leap(i) ? 366 : 365) * 86400;
184 value -= secs;
185 }
186 } else {
187 for (i = 1970; i < year; i++) {
188 secs = (is_leap(i) ? 366 : 365) * 86400;
189 value += secs;
190 }
191 }
192
193 *target = value;
194 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
195}
196
197isc_result_t
198dns_time32_fromtext(const char *source, uint32_t *target) {
199 int64_t value64;
200 isc_result_t result;
201 result = dns_time64_fromtext(source, &value64);
202 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
203 return (result);
204 *target = (uint32_t)value64;
205
206 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
207}
